questions.question: The Scaled Agile Framework approach for coordinating multiple Agile teams.
questions.explanation: SAFe provides a structured approach for scaling Agile practices across large enterprises with multiple teams.

questions.question: The Scrum at Scale concept where multiple Scrums coordinate through representatives.
questions.explanation: Scrum of Scrums is a coordination technique where representatives from multiple teams meet to synchronize work.

questions.question: The Extreme Programming practice of having the entire team collaborate on code simultaneously.
questions.explanation: Mob programming involves the whole team working on the same thing, at the same time, in the same space.

questions.question: The Kanban concept of visualizing and optimizing the entire value stream.
questions.explanation: Value Stream Mapping analyzes the flow of materials and information to identify waste and optimize delivery.

questions.question: The metric measuring time from request to delivery in Kanban.
questions.explanation: Lead time measures the total time from when work is requested until it's delivered to the customer.

questions.question: The Crystal methodology's approach to adjusting processes based on team size and criticality.
questions.explanation: Crystal methodologies adapt their practices based on factors like team size, system criticality, and project priorities.

questions.question: The Feature-Driven Development phase where overall model and feature list are created.
questions.explanation: FDD begins with creating a domain object model and identifying features to be built.

questions.question: The Lean principle of delaying decisions until the last responsible moment.
questions.explanation: Deferring commitment keeps options open and makes decisions based on the best available information.

questions.question: The practice of deploying code to production multiple times per day.
questions.explanation: Continuous Deployment automatically releases every change that passes automated tests to production.

questions.question: The Agile metric comparing planned versus actual Sprint completion.
questions.explanation: Burndown charts track remaining work over time, showing if the team is on track to complete Sprint goals.
